examples: in 1436 he gilded and painted statues for Bruges Town Hall
the first rays of the sun were gilding the grassy hillside

phrases: Yes, the producers gild the lily when they claim to be now, for the first time revealing things about the five leaders being examined.
It is not necessary to gild the lily by over ornate presentation.
If you want to gild the lily, scatter over grated cheddar cheese and return to oven until oozy and golden brown.
They believe they are right, and have never gilded the lily.
But all of them simply gild the lily.
origin: Old English gyldan, of Germanic origin; related to gold.
